intro: Duguetia inconspicua, commonly known as the pink-flowered tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Duguetia inconspicua is typically found in moist, shaded understories of tropical forests.
